Job Description:
As part of our new business initiatives, MSIM will be increasing our focus on Private Markets distribution to institutional investors in Southeast Asia and Hong Kong. Commensurate with this objective, we are looking for an experienced professional with the following skills, expertise, and experience.

1. The candidate should have 1 to 3 years experience focused on Private Markets at a large multi-strategy global alternative asset management firm.
2. Experience of Alternative Investment Management business and practices with proficient product knowledge in Alternative Investments and Private Markets Strategies.
3. Experience in working on the distribution of Alternative Funds and Co-investments across Private Equity, Private Credit, Real Estate, and Infrastructure.

4. Within the above segments, the candidate should understand the nuances for fundraising across sub-asset classes including:
a. Private Equity  Buyouts, Growth Capital.
b. Private Credit  Direct Lending, Opportunistic Credit, Real Estate Credit.
c. Real Estate  Core Real Estate, Opportunistic Real Estate.
d. Infrastructure  Core and Opportunistic Infrastructure, Energy, Renewables.

5. Roadshow Management - the candidate should possess extensive experience in managing roadshows for Private Markets distribution. This involves:
a. Internal. Coordination with the Fund Heads, Portfolio Managers, Administrative Personnel, and all other internal stakeholders to plan for the roadshow including meetings, travel arrangements, and logistical processes.
b. External. Monitor the outreach to investors, follow up with investors and their support staff to confirm meetings, venue details, etc. Ensure that the entire roadshow process is efficiently managed. Candidate should be familiar with the key investors across Southeast Asia and Hong Kong.
c. Prepare briefing notes and circulate to Fund Heads and Portfolio Managers prior to the roadshow.

6. Research Capabilities. Leveraging various technological resources including Salesforce, Preqin, ZoomInfo, Bloomberg. Conduct research related to LPs. Update the sales team on relevant market developments including industry fundraisings, new market entrants, personnel changes, etc.
7. Management Reporting  provide a Bi-Weekly update to senior management in Asia including an update on the current pipeline and next steps.
8. Prospecting and New Business Development. Demonstrated ability to prospect small and mid-sized investors. Develop new relationships through networking at conferences and industry events. Build and maintain relationships with junior and support staff at the investment companies.

Job Title: Head Of Business Finance Wrb Segments
Job Description:
Job Summary
The Head of Business Finance, WRB Segments will manage the financial performance of global WRB segments. This includes planning, performance management, segment analytics and providing advisory to relevant stakeholders to track and improve segment performance and to achieve agreed medium and long term targets.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsibilities for this finance role cover managing financial performance and underlying drivers of growth for following areas within WRB:
 Affluent segment
 Personal Segment and
 SME Segment
This will cover tracking, reporting and analysing various aspects for segment performance globally as defined below in detail.
Strategy
The Head of Business Finance, WRB Segments should have thorough awareness and understanding of the WRB business strategy and be able to help execute this to specific segment context globally.
This includes:
 Partnering with segment CFO and various segment heads in implementation of agreed strategy across markets
 Actively reporting, reviewing and analysing progress against set strategic targets.
 Alignment of this strategy and related financial impact, execution with key country finance colleagues and business partners
Business Planning and Analysis
 Advice stakeholders on financial performance, profitability, returns and highlighting areas of opportunity and early warnings of the challenges ahead
 Track financial and non-financial performance and momentum regularly
 Develop and implement financial and non-financial value drivers and regular measurement & analysis
 Conduct client segment deep dives to identify opportunities to improve income and returns; utilise these insights to modify or formulate new strategies with business stakeholders and finance partners
 Lead strategic multiyear planning process aligned with strategic priorities
 Partner with business and finance teams in markets to execute plans to improve market share including tactical and strategic actions
 Contribute to performance reporting and analysis for WRB Business Reviews
 Periodically review SCB performance against competitors and analyse relative strength and opportunity
 Effectively manage costs and lead appropriate prioritisation decisions to achieve cost efficiencies
 Support business on understanding and effective appropriate usage of various financial views- Enhanced Financial view, Management view, Market view and Franchise view

Key Responsibilities
Processes
Oversee following processes:
 Review and ownership of flash, outlook, forecasting and monthly performance for the business in coordination with offshore support teams
 Smooth and efficient corporate plan process and other internal finance processes specially forecasting alignment across region, country and Market/ Financial view interlock.
 Regular report and tracking financials and non-financial value drivers in coordination with analytics team and offshore support teams.
People & Talent
 Work effectively and collaboratively with finance/ non finance colleagues within WRB group finance, country finance and offshore teams
 Ensure ongoing training and self-development for both current role and future aspirations from a career growth perspective
 Guide other team members as a leader to get the optimum result
Risk Management
 Coordinate regular review with Risk to ensure appropriate capital deployment
 Review Risk Weighted Asset (RWA) performance vis--vis balance sheet growth and product/ client returns for the Affluent segments
 Regular review, reporting and understanding of loan impairment related to lending portfolios
 Ensure compliance with Group Accounting Principles and practices, Financial Control policy and other regulatory accounting guidelines
 Understanding of various regulatory requirement (eg Basel III/IV) and implementation of the same appropriately by working with product teams in group and markets
Governance
 Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates and the regulatory requirements and expectations to the role
 Represent the WRB finance function at key WRB Business forums and escalating any issues that may impact finance responsibilities
Regulatory & Business Conduct
 Display exemplary conduct and live by the Groups Values and Code of Conduct.
 Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
 Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key stakeholders
 CFO WRB Affluent and Segments
 CFO WRB

Our Ideal Candidate
 10+ years relevant experience in finance at a leading global financial services firm, preferably banking.
 Qualified Accountant i.e., CPA, CMA, ACCA or equivalent, or MBA (Finance) or other relevant qualification is preferred
 Track record of business partnering and ability to influence and effectively challenge stakeholders
 Strong understanding and/ or previous experience in consumer banking, wealth management or SME/ commercial banking is preferred
 Proven problem solver using quantitative techniques, strong analytical skills with ability to develop proof of concept frameworks and business cases
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively manage varied stakeholders and global teams within finance and business

Role Specific Technical Competencies
Performance Management
Business partnering and influencing
External reporting & Competitive analysis
Balance Sheet Management
Risk and Control

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.

Job Description:
Key responsibilities:

 Lead National Marketing Strategy: Develop and implement the national marketing strategy in collaboration with heads of individual business lines in Singapore and the Asia Pacific Marketing team.

 Creative and Content Leadership: Oversee the national creative, content, and media programs across traditional and digital channels, ensuring alignment with business strategy and regional campaigns, promoting national business lines and research content.

 Brand and Campaign Management: Manage internal and external brand campaigns, communications, and both online and offline content.

 Develop and Execute Marketing Priorities: Develop, execute, and measure strategies to drive pipeline, support business priorities, and build brand awareness with target segments.

 Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with various stakeholders across the Singapore business and leverage regional resources to proactively develop content and service marketing campaigns.

 Budget Management: Oversee marketing budget, and strategic plan for the marketing team. Performance Reporting: Regularly report on marketing performance metrics to senior management.

 Event Coordination: Plan and execute marketing events, both internal and external, to engage with employees, clients and key stakeholders.

 Brand Consistency: Ensure all marketing materials and communications are consistent with the Colliers brand guidelines.

 A Marketing or Communications Degree or relevant qualifications.
 Ability to manage a team and engage with a matrix of stakeholders across functions.
 Expertise in managing multiple projects and deadlines, with the flexibility to adjust priorities as needed.

Job Title: Head Business Finance Wrb  Singapore & Asean
Job Description:
Job Summary
Strategy
To support primarily the Singapore WRB business in the development and execution of the business strategies, delivering the corporate plan, specific strategic imperatives, and providing business and financial advice and insights by working with the WRB head in Singapore, WRB CFO, Singapore CFO and Group WRB Finance team. In addition, oversee WRB business in ASEAN and to participate in WRB Finance Global agendas and initiatives.
Business
 Financial and Strategic Indicators: To enhance shareholder value through guiding and supporting the delivery of the Singapore WRB financials and key performance indicators against internal and external benchmarks as well as strategic roadmap, delivering OP, and Return targets
 Business Efficiency: To have oversight and drive the delivery of the Business Efficiency in areas including cost plan delivery, supporting business in driving efficiency in frontline and digital channels, continuous focus in driving improvement in CIR% in particular.
 Projects, Initiatives, and Investments: To partner with the business teams and provide timely and objective insights and feedback on business and investment decisions, to ensure that investment resources are prioritised and capability built in line with the key enablers required by the region
Processes
 Apply Group Accounting and financial control policies, standards, procedures, and internal control practices and recommended appropriate financial policies / procedures in support of strategic business goals
 Evolve from product centric reporting to more client-focused financial reporting and analysis. Navigate and overcome challenges in the shortcomings of data availability, and with ultimate goal to drive improvement in shareholders value.
 Improve efficiency through automation and improve reporting and forecast practices by adapting advanced financial reporting tools and financial forecasting practice
 Improve wider collaboration across Singapore, ASEAN countries and global teams, apart from regular discussion of business and financial performance, drive best practices against countries, streamline and lead to consistent methodologies in financial analysis, and more focus on external business / financial performance against peer group and new emerging fintech industries than internal SCB benchmark / comparison.
People & Talent
 To lead a team of finance professionals through recruiting, retention, and development
 To re-energise the teams with growth mindset and connecting their work to business outcome
 Lead through example and build upon the culture and values. Set appropriate tone and expectations from their team and work in collaboration with risk and control partners
 Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of people, and ensure that holders of all critical functions and suitably skilled and qualified for their roles ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks
 Employ, engage, and retain high quality people, with succession planning for critical roles
 Set and monitor job description and objectives for direct reports and provide feedback and rewards in line with their performance against those responsibilities and objectives
Risk Management
 Participate and contribute in discussion in terms of ALCO, Basel working group, deposit working group, and other financial risk forum to ensure business finance is jointly working with wider finance communities on key polices, capital, funding, and financial control matters
Key Responsibilities
Governance
 Represent Finance in participating in core business investment and pricing discussion, including Pricing forum, branch investment forum, technology investment forum
 Bringing Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role
 Stay connected with markets changes in regulatory framework in PRA, Basel, SINGAPOREMA etc
Regulatory & Business Conduct
 Display exemplary conduct and live by the Groups Values and Code of Conduct.
 Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
 Lead the SINGAPORE RB, WM, and PvB Business Finance teams to achieve the outcomes set out in the Banks Conduct Principles: [Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.]
 Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key stakeholders
 Group WRB CFO
 Head, WRB, Singapore, and ASEAN and South Asia
 Singapore CFO
 Head, Wealth Management ASA and SG
 Regional Head, SEA and SG, PvB
 Financial counterparts in country, region, and group
 Auditors  E&Y
Our Ideal Candidate
Qualified accountant or equivalent.
10 + years of relevant experience and Extensive knowledge of Retail Banking and Wealth Management products, in particular of the SINGAPORE market, gained in senior Finance roles in complex international organisations
Strong business partner, team player with a strategic mindset and a track record of securing the confidence and respect of the peers and stakeholders.
A high degree of integrity and ability to influence and challenge the views and actions of others in a constructive manner, including C-suite stakeholders.
Commercial acumen, with a sense of materiality and decision-making capability
Dynamic leader of teams who role models Banks values and purposefully develops long term talent within the function.
Able to multi-task, operate effectively under ambiguities, uncertainties and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong networking and interpersonal skills, forming positive working relationship in the multicultural environment.
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Business knowledge (Retail Banking)
Business knowledge (Wealth Solution)
Business knowledge (Private bank)
ALCO / Liquidity / Capital
Finance digital transformation
Financial and Regulatory reporting
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
What we offer
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment Assessments
Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

Job Title: Senior Manager Technology Transformation & Service Readiness
Job Description:
Job Summary
The Senior Manager, Technology Transformation & Service Readiness is responsible for driving service readiness as part of the Catalyst Data Center migrations. This role plays a critical part in ensuring seamless business continuity as 300+ applications transition from old to new data centers. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with both business and Technology operations stakeholders to orchestrate all aspects of change, from preparation to post-migration operational activities.

Strategy
 Define and execute a comprehensive service readiness strategy for Catalyst data centre go live. This includes but not restricted to:
o Backup completion and validation
o DR Testing, contingency runbooks preparation and RTO/RPO alignment o Data Centre Operational readiness
o Business readiness pertaining to User impact assessments, contingency plans and stakeholder communications.
o TechOps readiness and Crisis management
 Monitor progress, address challenges, and resolve escalated issues related to change adoption
 Responsible for contributing to and driving the right Data Centre migration strategy for the bank and delivering on this migration.
 Maximize business value for Standard Chartered through areas of DC migration, optimization, sustainability, operational excellence. This will be done through synergy of people, process, tools, IT transformations, service delivery and architecture defined technology infrastructure.
 Have an overall understanding of the transformation plan from architectural as well as business perspective
 Establish and maintain strong, strategic partnerships with vendors and service suppliers
 Awareness and understanding of the Groups business strategy and model appropriate to the role
 Responsible for ensuring all dependencies are managed between each business vertical and horizontal when planning migrations
 Supporting IT projects from DC planning perspective for power, cooling, space and cabling requirements and performing optimization strategy on each allocation to maximise on the utility efficiency
 Conduct joint global Data Center domain and service delivery teams discussions to foster standardization and best practices for Data Center migration

Key Responsibilities
Business
 Collaborate with business units, operations teams, and other key stakeholders to ensure alignment and commitment to the service readiness process.
 Engage senior stakeholders to understand change impacts and assess business readiness for adopting planned changes.
 Oversee the implementation of Business Change activities
 Forge deep relationships with business line and functions CIOs and COOs to understand their data centre requirements
 Awareness and understanding of the wider business, economic and market environment in which the group operates.
 Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks in executing the strategy
Processes
 Coordinate business testing, migration, and cutover activities.
 Align to IBS, SS1 and Resilience priorities to ensure Business Resilience aspects are incorporate in the Change Plan
 Ensure smooth transitions and minimize disruptions during the migration process.
 Oversee post-migration operational activities to maintain business continuity
 Successful Migration: Ensure the seamless migration of 300+ applications to the new data center without compromising business operations.
 Change Adoption: Drive widespread adoption of new processes, tools, and ways of working across the organization.
 Work with TTO Governance to issue appropriate policies, procedures and quality checks.
 Have awareness of and understand all of the relevant regulatory frameworks for the markets in which Standard Chartered operate.
 Ensure compliance with all salient Standard Chartered governance frameworks.
 Embed Agile methodology and principles in the enterprise, reflected in mindset and culture changes.

People & Talent
 Identify, recruit and retain key talent, providing technical leadership across the team.
 Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Set appropriate tone and expectations from their team and work in collaboration with risk and control partners.
 Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of people and ensure that holders of all critical functions are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks.
 Employ, engage and retain high quality people.
 Set and monitor job descriptions and objectives for direct reports and provide feedback and rewards in line with their performance against those responsibilities and objectives.
 Create a motivational and challenging environment for staff which is conducive to creativity and performance with customer centricity in mind
 Integrate teams across Singapore and GBS centres in Chennai, Bangalore, and KL to create a cohesive execution focused culture
 Actively manage people cost. For e.g., driving down the usage of expensive contract staff
Risk Management
 Supporting Internal and external audits related to DC migration.
 Responsible for identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling and mitigating risks to the Group, as well as have firm treatment plans for all such risks and delivering on the treatment plans. Also, an awareness and understanding of the main risks facing the Group and the role the individual plays in managing them
 Interpret the Groups financial information, identify key issues based on this information and put in place appropriate controls and measures.
 Ensure a full understanding of the risk and control environment within Core Infrastructure Services, including
 Institutionalising clear systems and processes to ensure good governance and risk mitigation.
 Ensure robust support procedures are in place and adhere to Group Security Audit policies and locally within countries


Regulatory & Business Conduct
 Display exemplary conduct and live by the Groups Values and Code of Conduct.
 Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
 Lead the Data Centre Services team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Banks Conduct
Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment
 Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
 Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures.
 Responsible for building a culture of good conduct.

Key stakeholders
 Technology and Architecture Management Team
 TTO Management Team
 Business/ Function/ Country CIOs
 Chief Architect/ Group head, Technology
 Accountable Executives for bank wide strategic initiatives
 Risk and Finance COOs
 Global Internal Audit
 Operational Risk
 Development Managers
 Application Support Managers

Skills and Experience
Our Ideal Candidate
IT or science related tertiary qualification
ITSM related certifications preferred
10 years of experience in ITSM or tech/business domain within resilience
Experience in disaster recovery a plus
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Business Acumen
Systems Software Infrastructure
Vendor/Supplier Management
Data Center Administration
Agile Development
Data Center Automation
Strategic Thinking
Budget Management
Regulatory & Compliance
Risk Management
Manage People

Job Description:
As a Derivatives Settlements Analyst, your role will be pivotal in supporting the FICC Derivatives Settlements within the APAC region. You will be entrusted with the responsibility of liaising with clients on various trade settlements issues while ensuring the accuracy and completeness of settlement details. Your proactive nature will be crucial in controlling, monitoring, and resolving any settlements or system breaks status. Furthermore, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the team's projects and process improvement initiatives.
Liaise with clients on trade settlements issues including confirmation of settlement amounts, exchanging of SSIs and finalization of settlement confirmation arrangements.
Follow up and liaise with Trade Control, Client, and Front Office teams in resolving settlement related queries.
Ensure accuracy and completeness of settlement details in payment system.
Act as point of contact for clients on payment inquiries.
Control, monitor and resolve settlements/system breaks status.
Participate in the team's related projects and process improvement initiatives.
What you bring:
The ideal candidate for the Derivatives Settlements Analyst position brings a Diploma or Degree qualification along with a good understanding of Back office Operations responsibilities and processes. Your strong interpersonal and communication skills coupled with your proactive nature will enable you to excel in this role. A proficiency in MS Product Suite is essential, while product knowledge of FICC derivative products and ISDA Definitions would be advantageous. Your ability to work under pressure within a team environment will be key to your success.
Diploma or Degree qualification
Good organisational skills and understanding of Back office Operations responsibilities and processes.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Proactive nature
Ability to work under pressure in a team environment.
Proficiency in MS Product Suite
Product knowledge of FICC derivative products and ISDA Definitions preferred.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced and skilled Procurement Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing required materials, services and suppliers in both domestic and international markets. You will play a critical role in managing procurement activities, ensuring cost efficiency, and maintaining compliance with procurement policies and procedures.
Job Responsibilities
Source for required materials, services, and suppliers in the domestic and international market.
Understand purchase requirements and source accurately and efficiently.
Identify and engage with global prospective suppliers to foster beneficial relationships.
Understand market trends and seek to improve cost efficiency.
Perform daily procurement activities such as RFQ/RFP, negotiation of commercial terms, quotations evaluations and recommendations.
Coordinate procurement related matters with requestors and vendors.
Prepare and conduct tender process.
Propose new vendors and evaluate existing vendors.
Contracts management.
Working with legal counsel to review and prepare contractual documents.
Address procurement related queries from internal management and stakeholders.
Develop and implement procedures and processes, based on best practices, to ensure smooth and streamlined process.
Ensure compliance with procurement policies and procedures.

Job Description:
What you'll do:
As a Client Operations Executive, your role will be pivotal in ensuring smooth operations within the organisation. You will act as the first point of contact for clients, handling their account or trade-related queries. Your excellent problem-solving skills will be put to use as you monitor platform processes, ensuring successful execution of system batch runs for hourly settlements. In case of any system or data feed outage, you will activate contingency procedures to mitigate impact. You will also monitor members' margin balance positions and manage margin calls proactively. Your keen eye for detail will be crucial in monitoring members' credit or concentration limits and managing risk limit exposure. Any major operational process, system run or data feed failures will be escalated by you to Ops management for prompt resolution. Additionally, you will perform level 1 analysis and review of market surveillance alerts.

What sets this company apart:
Our client offers a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of traditional finance and the innovative world of digital assets. Job Description:
Account Manager  Associate Director
SS&C is looking for a dynamic individual to support our growing fund administration business as an Account Manager. The Account Manager is responsible for ensuring that service delivery is optimized, adheres to our Service Level Agreements, and maintaining overall client satisfaction across the full scope of services received from SS&C.
The Account Manager serves as a key point of contact for clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that the client experience is optimised. This includes service delivery oversight, implementation of new/enhanced services, client communication and management, and identification of improvement actions to maximise client satisfaction.
The Account Manager has ownership of client delivery, including though not limited to, oversight and accountability of the team looking after day to day processing activities which include Middle Back Office, and Fund Accounting. The Account Manager will require strong teamwork and problem-solving abilities in order to support the operations and fund accounting function, including coaching and development of staff.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Ensure a full understanding of the clients needs and expectations across service delivery teams and provide clarity for the actions required to service the client.
Identify and coordinate service delivery modifications in response to changes in client activities or regulation, and raise change projects within the organization as required.
Coordinate and drive resolution of issues affecting the quality of service and overall client experience.
Manage client communication and internal coordination on client requests for service enhancement, expansion, or customization.
Plan and attend engagement meetings with clients on a regular basis to build trust and deepen the client relationship.
Manage the team and provide leadership, training, and coaching to the managers and fund accountants in the team.
Identify and produce appropriate key management information / business metrics to communicate and facilitate the client relationship.
Manage due diligence meetings/responses for prospective or existing clients and their investors.
Oversee the preparation of board reports and represent the organization in client board meetings.
Ensure proper coordination of relationships with third parties related to the client activity, including system providers, auditors and external legal counsels.
Requirements:
University degree in finance/accounting or commensurate experience
At least 8+ years experience working within a financial services environment in a Fund Accounting or Operations role, preferably in the Hedge Funds space.
Strong client and team management skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills  ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with clients, team, peers, and management.
Forward-thinking with the ability to anticipate issues and drive solutions.
Ability to work in changing, fast-paced work environment
Good time management and organizational skills.
Resourceful, possess a can-do and continuous improvement mindset.
Has track record of delivering on process improvements.

Job Description:
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity ?As a Omnissa End User Computing (EUC) Customer Success Architect (CSA), you will have a direct positive impact on customer adoption of Omnissa Workspace ONE. As a trusted technical advisor your role is to help our most important customers accelerate time to value by overcoming technical barriers to adoption. This is accomplished through a consultative approach where you will leverage your deep technical skills, as well as communication skills, to conduct technical workshops, assist with troubleshooting and integrations (3rd party products, applications) and participate in customer working groups. You may also work in close collaboration with Program Management and Engineering to influence the direction of Omnissas products. You will provide technical thought leadership for EUC emerging products for internal teams and for our Omnissa customers relative to their EUC strategies. You will be a member of a high-octane, high performing global team that will demand your best and provide the most fulfilling work of your career.What is primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?
The product area of responsibility is Workspace ONE. Workspace ONE is a digital workspace platform that delivers and manages any application on any device by integrating access control, application management and multi-platform end-point management.
You will design and present technical concepts and specific solutions to internal and external audiences of varying technical capabilities in a clear, concise and easily understood manner.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
Lead and support product adoption activities as Customer Success Architect. Adoption here will be measured on increment of product usage in scale, increment of features enabled in the product for full experience of the product
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
Deliver product implementation guidance (via Zoom sessions and in-person whiteboard sessions) and oversight regarding the technical journey to customer value.
Apply creative thinking/approaches to figure out technical solutions that further business goals and align with corporate technology strategies, keeping in mind performance, reliability, scalability, usability, security, flexibility, and cost.
Advise customers on EUC related operational readiness matters such as: Service Orientation, Operations Control, and Infrastructure Control.
Define and promote the adoption of best practices of Omnissa products across the user community
Contribute to the companys strategic objectives by finding opportunities for product, people, and process improvement.
Build and maintain the confidence of colleagues, managers, and customers.
Required skills and experience:Desired skills/experience/certification:
Minimum of 10 years relevant IT experience (identity and access management, mobility, networking, monitoring, security, performance, HA/DR, databases)
Minimum of 5 years experience in customer-facing positions as a professional services consultant, preferably with an IT software or hands-on consulting organization
3+ years hands on experience with Virtual Desktop Infrastructure, including sizing guidelines, administrative best practices, end-user experience, and ideally, hosted desktop environments.
2+ years experience with Identity and Access Management, including experience with Single Sign-On (SSO) and industry-common SSO standards (e.g. SAML, OAUTH, OIDC, WS, or similar).
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment demonstrating autonomy while conforming to strategic intent, adhering to team values always
Technical knowledge of various MS Windows operating systems and database solutions including scripting with PowerShell, VBScript, registry hacking, automated deployment techniques, and driver integration
Excellent communications and social skills, especially public speaking and presentation skills
B.S./B.A./M.S. degree or equivalent technical training
What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?This role reports to a Director in Customer Success Architect org. He has been working as architect also in the industry before he transitioned to the current role. The team believes in empowering young talents and encourage each team member to develop and contribute through using their strengths. The leadership team also focuses on establishing an environment where team members are comfortable providing their comments and feeling motivated to experience with new ideas.

ClearSK manages the award-winning ClearSK chain of medi-aesthetic centres, with a strong presence in Singapore, Shanghai, Hangzhou, and Kuala Lumpur. We are currently seeking a proactive Clinic Executive to join our dynamic team. The Clinic Executive will be responsible for ensuring smooth operations at the front desk, providing excellent customer service, and supporting administrative tasks. This role requires someone with a keen eye for detail, strong organizational skills, and a passion for delivering an exceptional customer experience.

- Comprehensive on job training and professional guidance provided.
- Fast-track career path for the fast learner and high performer
- Opportunity to work alongside doctors and management.

Provide excellent customer service, including check-in/out procedures and addressing customers inquiries.

Willingness to adapt and participate in job rotation and career path planning.
Excellent organizational abilities with a high level of attention to detail.
Proficient in IT systems
Pleasant personality, impeccable integrity, responsible, responsive, able to work under pressure and independently.

Job Description:
What the day will look like
Drive the negotiation and placement of insurance/reinsurance contracts, producing desktop & market quotations and lead terms, for the Specialty;
Apply market expertise to design, deliver, innovate and place new/expanded business opportunities, renewals and mid-term adjustments and claims to improve market competitiveness, drive growth and optimal outcomes clients
Partner with Aon resources (Sales & Marketing, Specialty Team, GBC network and in-Country teams) to deliver the widest practical range of insurance solutions and services to client.
Complete contributions to tender responses for the Specialty to ensure timely submission and quality of reports
Ensure implementation of broking excellence initiatives including: Client Promise; Sales / Cross Selling; Wording/Slip standardization; Standard Contracts; Data Quality; Broking operations process flow; Carrier / market engagements.
Interface with the market and to secure optimum outcome for client risk coverage

Assist the team leader to implement growth strategy for the team

Contribute to regular "State of the Market" reports for the Specialty updating on market trends and losses relevant to the Specialty.
Ensure knowledge and best practice approaches are captured, documented and shared to ensure resiliency in the broking function for the Specialty
Responsibility to ensure that all broking / placement activity is in compliance with MAS regulations and Aon Company Policy and Guidelines.

Preferably 6 to 10 years of Insurance and/or Reinsurance market experience, in the Construction and Power and Renewable Energy Sector

Competent in Word, Excel
High motivational and ability to work independently nd take initiative
Good client relationships with both insurers and reinsurers

Job Description:
Job Summary
Oversee development and implementation-of a Real Estate Asset Management Strategy & Execution plan across SCBs ASEAN & (ASA) Footprint, aligned to SCB and Property Strategy which include key elements of a 5 year plan:
Rental Escalation Plan
Asset Acquisition/Divestment Plan
5 year Cash & P&L view
Implementing the agreed 5 year Supply Partner Contract (annual value of approx.. $3m) and planning for continuous improvement of the 3rd party strategy (incl. ownership of any Supply Partner RFP activity)
Business
Develop and Maintain key relationships with Asset Management partner functions, to develop and enable seamless execution of property plans, incl. but not limited to Global Leads within Finance, Risk, Compliance, Resilience, Treasury, Legal, OR and SCM.
Ensure that  where applicable - impact of material property decisions around Real Estate Assets are aligned with CIB and WRB client teams.
Develop and improve an Asset Management delivery platform across SCB ASEAN & ASA Footprint, which can accelerate and improve the execution of WRBs Retail Transformation agenda.
Alignment of key Asset Management success factors with ASEAN & ASA Business and Property stakeholders
Processes, Risk Management & Governance
As the only SCB FTE role in Asset Management in ASEAN & ASA, the role is accountable for adherence to the Asset Management process framework within the Property Process Universe. This includes
sign off on process defined activities,
oversight of Supply Partners process adherence, as well as
continuously seek to simplify the effectiveness of the governance framework in liaison with relevant Stakeholders and provide best practice & regional Relevance to Global Framework reviews
Key Responsibilities
People & Talent
 Build a team of diverse, passionate and capable individuals, which includes people in SCB and our chosen supply partner.
 Proactively support our partner in identifying gaps and strength within the Asset Management teams, so people changes can be managed strategically, minimizing unforeseen attrition and Business disruption.
 Ensure the Regional teams are strongly connected across the bank and external organisation, enabling a sharing & learning culture around best practices.
 Create a culture which enables staff (both SCB and 3rd party) to manage and prioritize workload, resulting in a productive and resilient workforce.
Partnership & Delivery
 Create a working culture which makes SCB an account of choice, attracting the best market talents and reduce attrition.
 Oversee and Manage the ASEAN &SA budget of the Supply Partner dedicated resources and variable Fees.
 Manage and improve Supply Partners Performance by defining and actively monitoring key performance indicators.
 Build & leverage core relationships with Developers / Landlords, and where applicable support or lead principle to principle negotiations on major Real Estate Transactions
 Oversee ASEAN & SA and Country driven key transactions, including alignment to global strategies and, SCB Group Stakeholders.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
 Display exemplary conduct and live by the Groups Values and Code of Conduct.
 Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
 Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.

Key stakeholders
 Head of Property (ASA); Country Heads of Property across ASEAN & SA
 ASEAN & SA SCB Functional Leads (SCM, Treasury, Risk, Compliance, OCIR, Legal and Finance)
 ASEAN & SA Property SME Leads (Supply Partner Management, Workplace, Security & Safety, Operational Risk, Data & Analytics, Process, Governance & Efficiency, Change & Transformation and the Property COO)
 Where Asset Management activities could affect CIB clients, their respective Relationship Managers
 Member of the Asset Management Core Leadership Team, which sets out the strategic direction, partnerships, Best in Industry Practices and brand recognition of the function.
 Member of the ASEAN & SA Property Management Team, which oversees the development, alignment and delivery of the overall ASEAN &SA Property strategy which aims to implement new ways of working, enables a more innovative culture, becomes more sustainable and drives costs efficiencies.
Our Ideal Candidate
Bachelors Degree in Commerce, Real Estate (Masters a plus), Preferably a bachelors degree in Real Estate other Business related discipline
10+ years of experience in working for property related businesses
Knowledge of the facilities / real estate market and Supply Partners, as well as keen understanding of customer service principles
Exceptional leadership capabilities and experience management large multi-disciplinary teams
Strong Communication and Influencing skills
Exposure to working with multi-cultural/geographic teams.
Data- oriented personality with a client centric mindset.
Role Specific Technical Competencies
People Development
Business Acumen
Finance
Operational Risk
Stakeholder Management
Strategy Development
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
What we offer
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment Assessments
Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

Job Description:
The Domain Coach is pivotal in embedding agile principles and ways of working within the Domain, guiding the leadership team, and ensuring that the delivery of value is customer-centric and aligned with Rio Tinto's strategic objectives. This role is responsible for facilitating the adoption and maturity of agile ways of working, advocating continuous improvement, and enhancing team collaboration and decision-making.
By driving the adoption of lean-agile metrics and practices, the Domain Coach plays a crucial role in optimising processes, resolving conflicts, and acting as a liaison with governance bodies to tailor domain strategies effectively within the broader organisational framework. Their expertise in SAFe principles and leadership skills are central to nurturing a culture that is adaptable, innovative, and committed to delivering sustained value. The Domain Coachs primary responsibility lies in leading by influence rather than authority, playing a supportive role in the Domains agile journey.
Customer Value Optimisation: Articulate and continually refine the Domain's value proposition, tailoring lean-agile principles to maximize customer-focused outcomes and guide Domain strategy
Agile leadership and role modelling: Champion and lead the Domains ways of working, supporting agility, advocating for cultural shifts towards a more innovative and responsive mindset, and coaching the Domain Leadership Team on embracing and implementing an agile mindset through training and coaching, helping to guide the pathway to agile maturity. Brings in lean-agile standards and capabilities from their Chapter and the LACE. Helps to transform mindset, brings knowledge and support to teams and individuals
Governance Collaboration: Maintain a transparent and effective interface between the Domain and Rio Tinto's governance structures, negotiating any necessary adaptations to standard processes to better suit Domain objectives
Empowerment and Decision-Making: Instill a culture of distributed decision-making and empowerment, fostering collaborative cross-domain interactions and coordinating efforts to optimise the Domain's performance
Continuous Improvement and Facilitation: Drive ongoing improvements aligned with organisation principles, utilising feedback mechanisms for iterative enhancement and leading agile practices and events to facilitate team progress
Data-Driven Insights and Conflict Management: Leverage agile metrics for informed decision-making and problem-solving, assisting in conflict resolution to nurture a collaborative and progressive Domain environment
The Domain Coach is pivotal in promoting customer-focused value delivery and agile adoption within Rio Tinto, championing lean-agile principles, enhancing dialogue with governance, and uplifting ways of working in support of improved outcomes. This includes enabling the Domain Leadership Team through distributed decision-making, encouraging an agile mindset for innovation, and streamlining stakeholder communication to refine processes. They work with Product Line Owners and Release Train Engineers, using Agile metrics to guide decisions, mediate conflicts, and implement Lean Portfolio Management.

Expertise:
Applies agile principles and practices effectively within the Domain's context, enhancing strategic alignment and enabling a culture of fast feedback and continuous delivery
Strong facilitation skills; providing content-neutral guidance for individuals and groups leading to actionable solutions
Professional coaching, teaching and mentoring, building collaborative partnerships with a focus on self-directed learning and problem resolution
Leadership:
Navigates and aligns executive expectations with agile approaches, crucial for transforming traditional mindsets and driving business agility
Demonstrates experience in leading change, guiding the Domain through transitions with a focus on enhancing agile competencies across teams and stakeholders
Strategic:
Exhibits strong problem-solving capabilities, employing collaborative approaches to address challenges, which is key to maintaining progress and innovation in a dynamic environment
Interpersonal:
Possesses strong coaching skills to facilitate team growth, fostering self-organisation and improved performance which is essential for the sustainable success of ways of working
Maintains a commitment to continuous professional development and adapts to emerging agile practices, ensuring that the Domain remains at the forefront of industry advancements and best practices

Job Description:
Join our dynamic Secured Financing team in a pivotal role that promises growth, challenge and the chance to contribute significantly to our business strategy, operational excellence and value generation. Operating from Sydney or Singapore, you'll be central to our expanding operations, driving growth and enhancing our trading capabilities.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. Youll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

What role will you play?
You will be responsible for helping to manage increasing trading activities within Repo and Securities Financing by leveraging your background in Asia Pacific Fixed Income financing while focusing on funding optimisation, liquidity, collateral management and risk management. In addition, you will contribute to the teams expertise with your experience in bond trading, credit risk management (including liquidation events) and derivative trading.

What you offer
Strong track record in risk management and trading within the Fixed Income Financing domain
Experience with Global Master Repurchase Agreements and Global Master Securities Lending Agreements and a deep understanding of FX basis trading
Expertise in bond trading, including derivatives, and the management of credit events and liquidations
Exceptional analytical, numerical, communication skills and strong design thinking
A proactive, hands-on approach combined with strong client engagement skills.
We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

About Commodities and Global Markets
In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to a diverse client base.

Benefits
Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
One wellbeing leave day per year
Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
Other benefits to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
Access a wide range of learning and development opportunities

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.

If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

Job Description:
Job Title: Sales Manager

Company Overview:
Story Wedding is a renowned bridal boutique, specializing in exquisite wedding gowns and suits. Our goal is to offer clients a seamless and personalized experience, ensuring they look their best on their special day.

Position Overview:
We are looking for a Sales Manager with strong expertise in bridal and formalwear sales, alongside a solid understanding of fabrics, tailoring, and garment design. This role is not about tailoring itself, but rather about using that knowledge to elevate sales efforts. The Sales Manager will play a key role in improving our product offerings and sales processes, providing experience to
younger team members, and addressing customer inquiries with confidence and professionalism. While the current Sales Manager leads the team, this role will focus on refining sales strategies and assisting with client consultations. With demonstrated interpersonal skills, there is potential to start leading a team within 5 6 months.


Key Responsibilities: (upon onboarding)

Daily Route:

Product & Display Check:
1. Upon arrival, ensure all gowns, suits, and accessories are properly displayed and organized. Check that the showroom is visually appealing and ready for client appointments.

Client Appointment Review:
Review the day's schedule, including upcoming client consultations and fittings. Prepare personalized recommendations and insights based on client preferences.

Team Briefing:
Hold a brief meeting with the sales team to discuss daily goals, ongoing projects, and any challenges
from the previous day. Offer guidance on handling customer inquiries and product details.


Sales Consultation:

1. Engage with clients to understand their needs and preferences, offering personalized recommendations on wedding gowns and suits.

2. Use fabric and design knowledge to confidently address client inquiries about the quality, feel, andfunctionality of our products.

3. Support clients throughout the selection, fitting, and alteration processes, ensuring a smooth and professional experience.

Product Knowledge & Process Improvement:

1. Utilize expertise in fabrics and garment construction to enhance the sales pitch, providing clients with insights that help them make informed decisions.

2. Work closely with the design and production teams to ensure that sales strategies are aligned with the latest product innovations and trends.

3. Contribute to improving the sales process, particularly around client consultations, fittings, and alterations, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.


Mentorship & Collaboration:

1. Share experience and product knowledge with younger sales team members, helping them to improve their client interactions and product knowledge.

2. Collaborate with the current Sales Manager to support the team without disrupting the existing company structure.

3. Over time, and depending on interpersonal and leadership skills, transition into a team lead role, providing further guidance and management within 56 months.

Client Experience & After-Sales Support:

1. Assist clients with questions regarding fittings and alterations, ensuring that they feel supported throughout the process.

2. Help refine the customer experience during fittings and follow-ups, ensuring that each step from selection to final adjustment is handled efficiently and professionally. What You Will Accomplish Upon Onboarding:

Technical Skills and Competencies:
1. To learn Communication Skills
2. To learn Organizational Skills
3. To learn Problem-Solving Skills
4. To learn Customer Service Skills
5. To learn Creativity
6. To learn to pay attention to Detail


Duration of Attachment Offered
6 months

Job Description:
Job Summary
We are looking for enthusiastic and reliable Flyer Distributors to promote our products/services by distributing flyers to the public. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the flyers are handed out in strategic locations to maximize visibility and drive awareness. This role requires strong communication skills and the ability to engage with potential customers politely and professionally.
Key Responsibilities:
 Distribute flyers to designated locations, including but not limited to shopping malls, residential areas, events, public spaces, and business districts.
 Engage with the public in a friendly and approachable manner, answering basic questions related to the product or service being promoted.
 Ensure effective coverage of all designated areas, maximizing exposure.
 Monitor flyer inventory and report low stock to the supervisor.
 Provide feedback on public response to flyers and share any insights with the marketing team.
 Keep records of the areas covered and report back to the supervisor.
 Maintain a professional appearance and represent the company positively at all times.
Key Requirements:
 No prior experience required; on-the-job training will be provided.
 Must be physically fit, able to walk or stand for extended periods.
 Friendly, outgoing personality with good communication skills.
 Punctual and reliable; able to meet distribution targets.
 Ability to follow instructions and adhere to the distribution plan.
 Attention to detail when recording areas covered and feedback.
Additional Information:
 Working hours: 12 pm to 7 pm, 6 days rotating workdays
 Distribution locations: Singapore Flyer and surrounding areas
 Flyers may be distributed individually or as part of a team.

About Us:
MindFlex Education Pte Ltd is Singapore's #1 and largest Education Agency. Our team is highly focused on bringing the best value to our clients, whilst building an enjoyable and vibrant office culture. Cultivating and caring about our personnel remains at the heart of our company. We promote a fun-filled family-like environment with no overtime culture.
We are currently expanding and looking for fresh & enthusiastic talent to join our team. If you are a great team player with a good sense of responsibility and work ethic, do apply to for this role and we would love to get in touch with you!

Job Scope:
- Handle Day-To-Day Business Operations of Singapore's #1 Education Agency
- Attend to interested clients via various forms of warm leads (form orders, calls, WhatsApp, etc)
(no cold-calling at all!)
- Assist clients in shortlisting and recommending suitable tutor profiles based on their criteria
- Coordinate and arrange 1st tuition lesson for both clients and tutors
- Follow-up with any necessary administrative support and after-sales service
- Familiarize with and utilize custom-made company software which is focused on automation

Job Requirements:
- Friendly, Passionate and Energetic Team Player
- Organized and Good Administrative Skills
- Responsible and Strong Work Ethic
- Decent Typing Speed and Computer Skills
- Polite, Patient and Good Customer Services Skills
- Able to Commit for Minimum of 1 Year
- Poly & University Fresh Graduates are welcome, no experience required

Salary:
- Competitive salary structured towards helping employees grow with the company
- $2,700-$4,300/Month + CPF (inclusive of team incentives)
- Base starts from $2,500-$3,500/Month
- Attractive monthly team incentives from $200-$800/Month
- Clear Salary Progression, Annual Salary Review (Minimum 5-10% Increase)
- Management positions available (for candidates identified with leadership potential)

Working Hours:
- 4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend OR 3 Weekdays 2 Weekends
- 9.00am - 6.30pm
- Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture

Why Choose Us:
- Fun Working Environment with a Warm Company Culture
- Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
- Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, Massage Chair, Fully-stocked Pantry, etc.)
- Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities

- Career Progression and Low Staff Turnover Rate
- Bright Hill MRT (Thomson-East Coast Line) at Doorstep of Office

Job Description:
Job Title : Payroll Executive/Specialist
Job Type : Contract 2 years, Extendable
Job Location : East Singapore

Job Responsibilities:
 Handle and process monthly payroll, claims, incentives, reimbursement and allowance payments.
 Reconciliation of payroll records, data verification and administration.
 Troubleshooting and rectifying any payroll related errors with internal and external stakeholders.
 To liaise with internal and external stakeholders for personal tax reporting, process annual income tax filing and submission within the stipulated deadlines.
 Responsible to provide & generate monthly / ad-hoc payroll Reports, with detailed breakdowns, medical and claim reports, GL and other finance reports, monthly payroll reconciliation report or any other related report.
 Any other payroll tasks and projects as assigned.

Job Requirements:
 Minimum Diploma in HR or equivalent.
 Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in payroll processing for at least 300 headcounts. Experience with WorkDay and Excelity systems will be an advantage
 Good understanding of whole payroll cycle, CPF Act and taxation regulations.
 Should have an ability to connect well across all levels.
 Highly meticulous and with an eye for detail.

If your skills & experience match the requirement, please share your updated CV in MS Word Format stating your current, expected salary details & availability at manisha.s@rmagroup.com.sg to take it forward. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.All Curriculum Vitaes will be treated with the strictest confidentiality.

This is in partnership with the Employment and Employability Institute Pte Ltd (e2i).
e2i is the empowering network for workers and employers seeking employment and employability solutions. e2i serves as a bridge between workers and employers, connecting with workers to offer job security through job-matching, career guidance and skills upgrading services, and partnering employers to address their manpower needs through recruitment, training, and job redesign solutions. e2i is a tripartite initiative of the National Trades Union Congress set up to support nation-wide manpower and skills upgrading initiatives. By applying for this role, you consent to RMA Groupss PDPA and e2is PDPA.

Manisha Sharma
RMA Consultants Pte Ltd
EA License No 93C4403
EA Regn No R187260

Job Description:
About CGSI
CGS International Securities Pte. Ltd. (CGS International) is an award-winning and market leading integrated financial services provider, ranked among the top securities houses in Asia.

CGS International taps on our wealth of global and ASEAN insights to offer equities trading, leveraged products, wealth management, investment banking, equities research, Shariah-compliant financing, fixed income, currency and commodities, structured products, and prime brokerage services in over 15 countries and regions.

Along with its parent organization China Galaxy Securities, a leading securities house in China, CGS International is trusted by more than 15 million customers globally.

About the role:
CGS International has embarked on Data & Analytics journey with the objective to become truly data-driven decision-making company. As a data analyst in the Analytics Centre of Excellence you will be part of a dynamic team whose mandate is to bring about data driven transformation for the Group.

We are looking to hire an experience data analyst to join our data team. The data analyst is responsible to conducts the conversion of data into insights that will lead to informed business decisions. He/She will need to works directly with stakeholders from the business and executives within the assigned departments. With extensive experience in Power BI visualization, have the ability to develop insights and dashboard but also coach and guide users in Power BI best practices. The data analyst will support the development of the strategic agenda and system deployment for analytics and visualization including technology and system roadmap.

Job responsibilities:
Ability to interact with various business stakeholders and functional units to understand their reporting needs
Understand business drivers/ priorities and identify opportunities where analytics can create significant value
Translate business problems / opportunities into tangible analytics requirements and recommend potential solutions
Serve as a bridge / conduit between product owners, technology team and Analytics CoE to experiment, develop, test and roll out successful data driven solutions
Expect incumbent to provide business support on Power BI development, as business is embarking on self-service journey for business intelligence and analytics
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
Training end users on new tech stack, develop best practices and self-service reports and dashboards.
Job requirement:
Strong knowledge and experience in MS Excel is a must
At least 2 year experience in designing and developing Power BI visualization and reporting
Experience in taking lead to implement Power BI, SSAS, DAX applications
Good understanding of BI Projects & Data Warehouse concepts
Proficient in Office 365, with knowledge of CRM platforms (e.g. Salesforce).
Familiarity with data management practices such as data governance and quality, business intelligence, data architecture and strategy, data security and privacy, data integration, master data management, and metadata management.
Passionate about solving problems  possesses a relentless need for investigation and data exploration.
Results and detail-oriented, with strong intuitions on how to solve problems creatively and quickly
Degree or professional qualifications in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Data Science, Statistics or equivalent degree.
Proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets
Experience tracking relevant KPIs (e.g. customer satisfaction)
A customer-oriented attitude
Excellent communication and negotiation skills
Problem-solving aptitude
Able to speak both english and chinese to converse with external clients
skills: ['CRM', 'Microsoft 365', 'Business Intelligence', 'Detail Oriented', 'Engaging with stakeholders', 'DAX', 'Data Management', 'Problem Solving', 'Data Integration', 'SSAS', 'Data Governance', 'Data Architecture', 'Business Analytics', 'Customer Satisfaction', 'Statistics', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'Data Analytics', 'Power BI', 'Master Data Management', 'Metadata Management']
Company: Cgs International Securities Singapore Pte. Ltd.

Job Description:
Job Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Live-Streaming & Events Administrative Assistant to provide essential administrative support for our live-streaming and events operations. This role involves managing contracts, handling invoicing, and providing general administrative assistance to ensure smooth and efficient event execution. The ideal candidate will need to be organized, proactive, and capable of juggling multiple administrative tasks in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities:
Agreement and Contract Management:
Prepare, review, and manage contracts and agreements with clients, vendors, and partners for live streaming and events.
Ensure all necessary documentation is signed, filed, and tracked for future reference.
Assist in negotiating terms of agreements where necessary, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal standards.
Invoicing & Financial Administration:
Generate and send invoices to clients and partners for live-streaming services and event coordination.
Track payments and follow up on overdue invoices, ensuring timely collection.
Assist in budgeting and financial reporting for live-streaming and event projects.
Event Administration Support:
Provide administrative assistance to the events team, including managing event timelines.
Maintain databases and spreadsheets for tracking client details, event schedules, and vendor information.
Document Management:
Organize and maintain digital and physical files for all live-streaming and event-related documents.
Ensure that important contracts, financial documents, and correspondence are accessible and stored securely.
Administrative Tasks:
Provide general administrative support, including answering emails, managing calendars, and processing expense reports.
Assist with preparing presentations, reports, and other documents as required by the live streaming and events team.
Qualifications:
Diploma or Bachelors degree in business administration, event management, or a related field.
Proficiency in Mandarin and English to accommodate our clients' needs.
Proven experience in an administrative role, preferably within live streaming, events, or media industries.
Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace tools.
Experience with invoicing and financial tracking software.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with event planning and live-streaming services.
skills: ['Document Management', 'Excellent Communication Skills', 'Microsoft Office', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Work Well Under Pressure', 'Contract Management', 'Invoicing', 'Administration', 'Event Management', 'Event Planning', 'Attention to Detail', 'Spreadsheets', 'Administrative Support', 'Databases', 'Financial Reporting']
